Difficulty: Just Right The Bottom Line: Great Multiplayer/Great Score: 8.0  Note: This Game Been Tried Out And Reviewed In Offline Mode or On Another Steam Account And Or Consoles.  Monday Night Combat is a multiplayer shooter game that incorporates shooter mechanics, tactical tower defense mechanics, and fun mechanics into one package. So did this bizarre mix of mechanics work to the game's benefit or did it just end up being too much for one little game to take in.  Monday Night Combat may be a small game, but it was able to take in a deep breath and work the air through its system smoothly allowing for an entirely new take on multiplayer shooters.  Overall: Monday Night Combat is an enjoyable and unique multiplayer shooter that incorporates a whole lot of different mechanics into a little game. The end result is an engrossing and highly addictive experience that makes it all the worthwhile to explore the depths of indie multiplayer games.

It's easy to confuse this game as a TF2 clone considering the cartoon style of the characters, however, the gameplay is nothing like that multiplayer classic. Gone are the massive servers crowded with dozens of players, opting instead for a 6 vs. 6 game where teamwork goes far towards winning the match. Matches are fast-paced and you'll find yourself running through half a dozen matches in a single sitting pretty quickly. It's easy to learn the basics but with a reward system that allows you to customize your characters abilities the more time you put in, you'll find yourself coming back with a new player design every chance you can. I highly recommend this multiplayer experience.

Monday Night Combat is one of the most fun competitive team games I've ever played.  It plays like a mash-up between TF2 (an FPS) and Dota (quasi-RTS), except not in either of those genres (3rd person shooter/action). Having been a long time fan of Dota, this is essentially that style of game in full 3D. So you'll be pushing bots, creeping enemy bots, and looking to kill enemy pros in order to get money and upgrade your skills.  The gameplay is frantic, strategical, and always a blast to play. But it's really the stylized characters and writing that help to make the experience so memorable. The gameplay is complimented by some hilarious dialogue that really brings the futuristc world of MNC to life. Think a parody of 1984 that's treated with just the right amount of humor and you'll get the picture.   If you're on the fence about MNC, then do yourself a favor and buy it. The learning curve can be a little steep, but the game is always fun and rewarding.
Its like if DoTA and TF2 had a love child.

Fun game, third person shooter/tower defense. Revolves around a ball of money contained in a sphere, called the Money Ball. Can play competitively, with both teams trying to get their swarms of robots to the enemy's moneyball to destroy it and win, or co-operatively, protecting the moneyball against increasingly difficult hordes of robots. Killing bots (or other players) gets you money, which you can spend on single-game character upgrades or turrets. And turret upgrades. While most games would pit red team against blue team, this game has ORANGE vs Blue, which is fine by me - orange is blue's actual opposite, after all. The characters don't have as much individual personality as Team Fortress 2's characters (which are hard to beat, kind of an unfair comparison?), but personalities do exist - most visibly with the Support class character. Good for those that enjoy both tower defense and third person shooters. If you prefer tower defense, play Blitz as a Support.

An absolutely fantastic 3rd person multiplayer shooter. Basically, it plays like Team Fortress 2, with it's mix of classes, combined with DoTA. You have bots which you must escort to the opposing team's base to destroy their Moneyball. You also have turrets to defend you Moneyball from the other team's atttack. This gives the game quite a frantic pace as you try to kill other players, kill bots and destroy turrents along with defending your own base.  The game has a fairly large learning curve, in that you'll need to spend some time learning one particular class to get into it. It's a little harsher than TF2 - probably because there are only 6 peeps per team in this game so can't be propped up as much by your teammates. Better players will also dominate you to begin with. Don't worry. Your K/D ratio means nothing and you'll get there eventually.  Once you're past the curve it's a really fun MP game. There are still some issues with Blitz - the co-op mode. Hopefully that's fixed soon.

Great team-based strategy/action game! I would describe it as Team Fortress 2 style gameplay and graphics combined with the strategy and teamwork necessary in League of Legends. Class diversity and working together are essential to win, as each map is split into several 'lanes' where your team's robots (as well as the other team's on their side) spawn, and have a specific route they go depending on their lane. Your job is to clear the way, while watching out for enemy 'Pro' players (the classes are called 'Pros') and killing them if necessary, which it usually is. But don't be fooled, this game is not all about racking up the kills! You will want to lead the robots to the opposing team's 'Money Ball,' which can be considered the home base of their base, and have them attack it while you help. The robots bring down the Money Ball's protective shield, but watch out for Turrets throughout the base! If you find serious players who work together and talk, this game is VERY addicting!

Monday Night Combat is a really fun, intersting and challenging game. It is a lot like TF2 with the characters, though the characters have different skills that can be upgraded by attacking more players and earning money from kills. You have a different variety of turrets, and you have bots that aid you in attacking the other side.  It requires team work and skill. Depending on who you have on the arena and who you have on your team, you need to strategise which best tactic to go about attacking the other side. Do you defend more and build turrets, or do you upgrade as fast as you can and attack the enemy base straight away.   It is a fun game that is still a bit of a work in progress, but there is certainly more involved, has a few fun maps and the characters and their different skills, make it really really enjoyable to play. Would like to see more maps and different games in the future, but for now it is a lot of fun for such a cheap game!

DOTA meets Team Fortress 2.   You have to destroy the enemy money ball to win, in order to do this you need to escort your army of bots to the enemy money ball and navigate a series of traps, enemy bots and players.   All the classes are fun and equally overpowered and two people of any class can work cooperatively to destroy an enemy team.  The only downside is the community. People apparently take this colorful, fun and fast paced game as very serious business and you are almost guaranteed one or two people in every match who will treat the game with the seriousness of Counterstrike with the smack talk of xbox live.  This is not too much of a problem however, as the frags come fast and regardless of how good someone thinks they are, you will be killing them... a lot, and you can rub salt in their wounds by taunting them for a bonus.
